name: Braised Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
author: Kimberly Lancaster
summary: This is a great side dish to serve with any grilled meat item or other vegetable dishes. I get many requests for this when catering. People who normally don't like Brussels sprouts love these!
ingredients: 2 pounds Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Melt butter with olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat
Saute onion and garlic in butter mixture until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes; add Brussels sprouts and saute until slightly browned on edges, 5 to 10 minutes
Sprinkle bacon, chicken bouillon, red pepper flakes, and black pepper over the sprouts mixture; stir and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes
Pour wine over the sprouts mixture, reduce heat to low, place a lid on the pot, and simmer until the sprouts are desired tenderness, 10 to 15 minutes
